intro: Endiandra longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-pedicelled endiandra, is a tropical tree species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces dark blue to black berries that are edible but often have a bitter taste. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
